snippets.snippet: Tenryū-ji, formally known as Tenryū Shiseizen-ji, is the head temple of the Tenryū-ji branch of the Rinzai sect of Zen Buddhism, located in Susukinobaba-chō, Ukyō Ward, Kyoto, Japan. Tenryu-ji Temple is situated 3½ km northwest of Kamikatsura. Photo: Osakaosaka, CC BY-SA 3.0.
